exposr 0.0.1
  • Reference

Calculate Emax or equivalent parameter given a target effect, ED50, and dose

Source: R/calculate_effect_param.R
calculate_effect_param.Rd

Supports standard Emax, sigmoid Emax, log-linear, quadratic, and betaMod models.

calculate_effect_param(
  delta,
  ed50,
  dose,
  model = c("emax", "sigmoid", "loglin", "quadratic", "betamod"),
  hill = 1,
  delta1 = NULL,
  delta2 = NULL,
  scal = NULL,
  e0 = 0
)

Arguments

delta

Numeric. Target effect (e.g. from Target Medicine Profile)

ed50

Numeric. Estimated ED50 of the drug (ignored for log-linear and quadratic)

dose

Numeric. Dose that leads to the target effect

model

Character. Model type: "emax", "sigmoid", "loglin", "quadratic", or "betamod"

hill

Numeric. Hill coefficient (only used for sigmoid model)

delta1

Numeric. Shape parameter 1 for betaMod (optional)

delta2

Numeric. Shape parameter 2 for betaMod (optional)

scal

Numeric. Scaling factor for betaMod (e.g. max dose)

e0

Numeric. Baseline effect (default is 0)

Value

Numeric. Estimated Emax or model-specific parameter

Examples

calculate_effect_param(delta = 1.5, ed50 = 10, dose = 160, model = "emax")
#> [1] 1.59375
calculate_effect_param(delta = 1.5, ed50 = 10, dose = 160, model = "sigmoid", hill = 2)
#> [1] 1.505859
calculate_effect_param(delta = 1.5, ed50 = NA, dose = 160, model = "loglin")
#> [1] 0.2955564
calculate_effect_param(delta = 1.5, ed50 = NA, dose = 160, model = "quadratic")
#> [1] 5.859375e-05
calculate_effect_param(delta = 1.5, ed50 = NA, dose = 160, model = "betamod", delta1 = 1.2, delta2 = 2, scal = 200)
#> [1] 5.900935
